body:
Changing num_global_features and num_data_dims fixed the problem 
```
; Number of total global features
num_global_features=4

; Unknown? (remove it next time)
num_data_dims=5

```

I had the same issue. That particular error was gone after changing the variables in the config (as mentioned above). However, now the program **segfaults** after one iteration.

```
...
Starting iterations
Training Iteration 0:
Accuracy - cells: 0.500672102 rows: 0.487090439 cols: 0.495236427 
 Loss     - cells: 0.694381773 rows: 0.72147584 cols: 0.726865649 
 Fraction - cells: 0.493346483 rows: 0.514542282 cols: 0.504710674 
 Total loss: 0.72147584
---------------------------------------------------
Validation Iteration 0:
Accuracy - cells: 0.504660308 rows: 0.500964344 cols: 0.496350169 
 Loss     - cells: 0.692633688 rows: 0.709815621 cols: 0.721956372 
 Fraction - cells: 0.495503753 rows: 0.495069176 cols: 0.503972471 
 Total loss: 0.709815621
---------------------------------------------------
Visualizing
Training Iteration 1:
Accuracy - cells: 0.495369285 rows: 0.498303801 cols: 0.499932796 
 Loss     - cells: 0.692240357 rows: 0.711595178 cols: 0.726988494 
 Fraction - cells: 0.504212081 rows: 0.496714324 cols: 0.500122249 
 Total loss: 0.711595178
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

@dexterslabs Did you encounter this? What do you think could be the reason for this segfault?

@dexterslabs Yes, you are right, global features are supposed to be four. That was causing the issue. I am using  the following configuration myself which works fine:
```
[gravnet_fast_conv_1]
from_scratch=1
is_sampling_balanced=1
batch_size=25
train_for_iterations=20000000000
learning_rate=0.0001
num_testing_samples=100
summary_path=/home/shahrukh/SundayOnwardOut/gravnet_fast_conv/summary
model_path=/home/shahrukh/SundayOnwardOut/gravnet_fast_conv/model
test_out_path=/home/shahrukh/SundayOnwardOut/gravnet_fast_conv/test

training_files_list=/home/hassanmahmood/tukldataset/train_files.txt
validation_files_list=/home/hassanmahmood/tukldataset/validate_files.txt
test_files_list=/home/hassanmahmood/tukldataset/test_files.txt

model=conv_grav_net_fast_conv
profiler_output_file_name=/home/shahrukh/SundayOnwardOut/gravnet_fast_conv/profiler
visual_feedback_out_path=/home/shahrukh/SundayOnwardOut/gravnet_fast_conv/visual_feedback
max_vertices=900
num_vertex_features=5
max_image_height=768
max_image_width=1366
image_channels=1
max_words_len=30
dim_vertex_x_position=0
dim_vertex_y_position=1
dim_vertex_x2_position=2
dim_vertex_y2_position=3
dim_num_vertices=2
num_global_features=4
dim_width=1
dim_height=0
num_data_dims=3
variable_scope=conv_grav_net_fast_conv_1
samples_per_vertex=6
loss_alpha=1
loss_beta=1
loss_gamma=1
save_after_iterations=50
validate_after=100
visualize_validation_results_after=150
```

@munikarmanish I am not sure about the segmentation fault. Have you managed to resolve it yet?

@shahrukhqasim When using _your_ config, the training ran for about 300 iterations and then **segfault**ed again! Could this be caused by insufficient memory? By the way, one interesting thing I noticed is that one of `row` and `cell` accuracies never reached more than ≈50% while the other two went up to 98%.

Also, what is the "Fraction" in the output?

```
Training Iteration 319:
 Accuracy - cells: 0.986933231 rows: 0.975857377 cols: 0.494874418 
 Loss     - cells: 0.0397053286 rows: 0.213991225 cols: 0.420835525 
 Fraction - cells: 0.504426718 rows: 0.500666559 cols: 0.505125642 
 Total loss: 0.224844024
```

Finally, how to use the saved model in "inference" mode? For instance, I want to send an image of a table along with the text blocks (from OCR). Is there a way to get the 3 matrices from these inputs?

@munikarmanish `fraction` was for debugging purposes as an estimate of classes distribution. It shows: class 0/(class 0 + class 1) fraction averaged over all the vertices and over the batch.

Yeah, I think it could be something related to memory; however, normally, TensorFlow throws a memory exception. I'll run again tonight to see if I am getting it. It was working fine last time I worked with this repository.
@hasslercastro Yes, I generated the synthetic dataset, and I noticed that it didn't have enough variations—same font, always 2 header rows, same alignment for all columns, similar shapes, etc.
@munikarmanish Ah okay, did you try with your own dataset?
@munikarmanish where you able to figure out how to send a image with OCR textblocks and get the 3 adj matrics.

@munikarmanish how did you resolve the segfaults issue. I am facing the same error and my GPU memory, for sure, is not exhausting as I am using very small batch size. nvidia-smi shows, 1200 MB/ 24GBs only
